member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.CommonAlgorithms.Cast(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.ImageType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the type of an image with the specified source, destination, type, and shifts.
member.param: The source image.
The destination image. Set this parameter equal to source or to perform the change directly on the source image.
The new type for the image. is the new type for the image if it is being used, otherwise it is the new type for .

The shift value for converting 16-bit images to 8-bit images. The method executes this conversion by shifting the 16-bit pixel values to the right by the specified number of shift operations, up to a maximum of 8 shift operations, and then truncating to get an 8-bit value. Enter a value of –1 to ignore the bit depth and shift 0. Enter a value of 0 to use the bit depth to cast the image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.CommonAlgorithms.Copy(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Copies the source image to the destination image, including the border size and calibration information.
member.param: The source image to copy.
The resulting image.
member.remarks:
Use this method with all image types.
To copy an area of one image to an area of another image, use the Extract2 method with xSubsample and ySubsample set to 1.
The and images must be the same type of image. The method copies the complete definition of the source image and its pixel data to the destination image. The method also modifies the border of the destination image so that it becomes the same size as the border of the source image.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy
member.summary: Specifies the policy used to perform the display mapping.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.MapFullDynamicRange
member.summary: (Obsolete) When image bit depth is 0, maps the full dynamic range to 8 bits.
member.remarks: This value has been deprecated. Use MapDefault instead to preserve this existing behavior. This method only maps the image values when the image bit depth is 0. Otherwise, the 8 most significant bits of the image are displayed. Use instead to have the mapping applied regardless of the image bit depth. Use instead to display the 8 most significant bits regardless of the image bit depth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.Downshift
member.summary: (Obsolete) When image bit depth is 0, applies a given number of right shifts to the 16-bit pixels.
member.remarks: This value has been deprecated. This method only maps the image values when the image bit depth is 0. Otherwise, the 8 most significant bits of the image are displayed. Use instead to have the mapping applied regardless of the image bit depth. Use instead to display the 8 most significant bits regardless of the image bit depth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.MapGivenRange
member.summary: (Obsolete) When image bit depth is 0, maps the pixel values in a specified range to an 8-bit scale.
member.remarks: This value has been deprecated. This method only maps the image values when the image bit depth is 0. Otherwise, the 8 most significant bits of the image are displayed. Use instead to have the mapping applied regardless of the image bit depth. Use instead to display the 8 most significant bits regardless of the image bit depth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.Map90PercentDynamicRange
member.summary: (Obsolete) When image bit depth is 0, maps the range corresponding to the center 90 percent of the cumulative histogram to 8 bits.
member.remarks: This value has been deprecated. This method only maps the image values when the image bit depth is 0. Otherwise, the 8 most significant bits of the image are displayed. Use instead to have the mapping applied regardless of the image bit depth. Use instead to display the 8 most significant bits regardless of the image bit depth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.MapGivenPercentRange
member.summary: (Obsolete) When image bit depth is 0, maps the pixel values in the relative percentage range (0 to 100) of the cumulated histogram to an 8-bit scale.
member.remarks: This value has been deprecated. This method only maps the image values when the image bit depth is 0. Otherwise, the 8 most significant bits of the image are displayed. Use instead to have the mapping applied regardless of the image bit depth. Use instead to display the 8 most significant bits regardless of the image bit depth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.MapDefault
member.summary: When image bit depth is 0, maps the full dynamic to 8 bits; otherwise, right shifts until the 8 most significant bits of the image are displayed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.UseMostSignificantBits
member.summary: Right shifts until the 8 most significant bits of the image are displayed as specified by the image bit depth.
member.remarks: When image bit depth is 0, shifts to the right 7 times for signed 16-bit images and 8 times for unsigned 16-bit images. Otherwise, the number of shifts is calculated by subtracting 8 from the image bit depth.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.MapFullDynamicRangeAlways
member.summary: Maps the full dynamic range to 8 bits.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.DownshiftAlways
member.summary: Applies a given number of right shifts to the 16-bit pixels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.MapGivenRangeAlways
member.summary: Maps the pixel values in a specified range to an 8-bit scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.Map90PercentDynamicRangeAlways
member.summary: Maps the range corresponding to the center 90 percent of the cumulative histogram to 8 bits.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.WindowsForms.DisplayMappingPolicy.MapGivenPercentRangeAlways
member.summary: Maps the pixel values in the relative percentage range (0 to 100) of the cumulated histogram to an 8-bit scale.

member.summary: No compression.

member.summary: JPEG compression. This compression may cause data degradation.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod
member.summary: Specifies the type of distortion for which the calibration information is learned.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod.Perspective
member.summary: Perspective calibration. This is a valid input to the NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LearnCalibrationGrid class and the NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LearnCalibrationPoints class. Use this method when lens distortion is negligible.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod.Nonlinear
member.summary: Nonlinear calibration. This is a valid input to the NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LearnCalibrationGrid class and the NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LearnCalibrationPoints class. Use this method if the image contains lens distortion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod.SimpleCalibration
member.summary: Simple calibration. The NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.VisionImage.GetCalibrationInfo returns this value for images calibrated by the NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.SetSimpleCalibration method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod.CorrectedImage
member.summary: Corrected. returns this for a corrected image. A corrected image contains information about the calibration unit and scaling factor.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod2
member.summary: Specifies the calibration method for which information is learned.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod2.Perspective
member.summary: Perspective calibration is used when lens distortion is negligible.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod2.Microplane
member.summary: Microplane calibration is used when the image contains lens distortion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod2.SimpleCalibration
member.summary: Simple calibration. The NationalInstruments.Vision.Algorithms.CalibrationGetCalibrationInfo returns this value for images calibrated using Simple calibration.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod2.CorrectedImage
member.summary: Corrected. A corrected image contains information about the calibration unit and scaling factor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.CalibrationMethod2.NoCalibration
member.summary: Image with no calibration.

member.summary: The corrected image is scaled such that the features in the image have the same size as the input image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.ScalingMethod.ScaleToFit
member.summary: The corrected image is scaled to be the same size as the input image.

member.summary: The area defined by the user-defined regions is corrected.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.ImagePreviewFileDialog.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the filters that display in the type listbox of a dialog box.
member.remarks:
Use the pipe ( | ) symbol (ASCII 124) to separate the description and filter values. Do not include spaces before or after the pipe symbol, because these spaces will be displayed with the description and filter values. The following code shows an example of a filter that enables the user to select bitmap files or JPEG files.
Bitmaps (*.bmp)|*.bmp|JPEGs (*.jpg)|*.jpg When you specify more than one filter for a dialog box, use the property to determine which filter is displayed as the default.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified filename.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.AviOutputSession.#ctor(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified file name and .
member.param: The name of the Audio Video Interleave (AVI) file to write.

The number of frames per second of this AVI. indicates the playback rate you want to use for the AVI you create. The AVI may play at a slower rate depending on the performance of the system it plays on. The default value is 30.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.AviOutputSession.#ctor(System.String,System.UInt32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified file name, compression filter, and .
member.param: The name of the Audio Video Interleave (AVI) file to write.

The number of frames per second of this AVI. indicates the playback rate you want to use for the AVI you create. The AVI may play at a slower rate depending on the performance of the system it plays on. The default value is 30.
The name of the compression filter to use. To get a list of valid compression filters on your system, call . By default, this parameter indicates that the method uses no compression.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.AviOutputSession.#ctor(System.String,System.UInt32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified file name, compression filter, quality, and .

The number of frames per second of this AVI. indicates the playback rate you want to use for the AVI you create. The AVI may play at a slower rate depending on the performance of the system it plays on. The default value is 30.
The name of the compression filter to use. To get a list of valid compression filters on your system, call . By default, this parameter indicates that the method uses no compression.
